steps.instruction: Go to the kitchen cupboard and bring out a clean, medium-sized cooking pot.
Place the pot on the stove.
Turn on the stove to medium heat.
Measure 1 standard cup (250ml) of palm oil.
steps.tip: Use a measuring cup for accuracy.

steps.instruction: Pour the palm oil into the pot on the stove.
Allow the oil to warm up for about 2 minutes. Do not let it bleach (change color drastically).
steps.tip: It should just be hot, not smoking.

steps.instruction: While the oil heats, take a small bowl and pour in the ground egusi (melon seeds).
Add about half a cup of water to the egusi and mix it with a spoon until it forms a thick paste.
steps.tip: It should look like stiff dough.

steps.instruction: Scoop the egusi paste into the warm oil in small lumps.
steps.tip: Use a spoon to drop it in.

steps.instruction: Fry the egusi balls for about 5-10 minutes, stirring gently so they don't burn.
Add the meat stock (water from boiling your meat) or plain water if you don't have stock.
Cover the pot and allow it to cook for 20 minutes.
steps.tip: Check occasionally to ensure it doesn't dry out.

steps.instruction: Add the cooked meat and stockfish to the pot.
Add the ground crayfish, salt, and pepper to taste.
steps.tip: Start with a little salt, you can always add more.

steps.instruction: Stir well and cook for another 10 minutes.
steps.tip: The oil should start appearing on top.

steps.instruction: Finally, add the chopped spinach or bitter leaf.
steps.tip: Wash the vegetables thoroughly before adding.

steps.instruction: Stir and let it simmer for 2 minutes, then turn off the stove.
steps.tip: Vegetables should stay fresh and green.

steps.instruction: Your Egusi Soup is ready! Serve with Pounded Yam or Eba.
Go to the kitchen cupboard and take out a large, heavy-bottomed pot.
Place the pot on the stove.
Take your blender out and plug it in.
steps.tip: Make sure your hands are dry.

steps.instruction: Wash 5 tomatoes and 2 onions thoroughly.
Cut the tomatoes and onions into chunks and put them in the blender.
Blend the mixture until it is completely smooth.
steps.tip: Add a splash of water if it helps blending.

steps.instruction: Turn on the stove to medium heat.
Pour 1 cup of vegetable oil into the pot.
steps.tip: Let it heat up for 2 minutes.

steps.instruction: Pour the blended tomato mix into the hot oil.
Fry the tomato stew for about 15-20 minutes until the oil floats to the top.
While the stew fries, measure 3 standard cups (250ml each) of rice.
Wash the rice thoroughly with cold water until the water runs clear.
Add the washed rice to the frying stew.
steps.tip: Stir well to coat every grain.

steps.instruction: Add water or stock until it is just above the level of the rice.
steps.tip: Do not add too much water.

steps.instruction: Add thyme, curry, salt, and seasoning cubes.
steps.tip: Taste the water, it should be slightly salty.

steps.instruction: Cover the pot tightly with a lid (or foil + lid) to trap steam.
steps.tip: Steam cooks the rice, not the water.

steps.instruction: Turn the heat down to the lowest setting.
Cook for 30-40 minutes without opening the pot frequently.
Once the water is dried, stir the rice with a wooden spoon.
steps.tip: Check if the grains are soft.

steps.instruction: Turn off the heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Your Jollof Rice is ready!
